name: Hilton Longboat Key Beachfront Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Loved the breakfast outside but there are pesky birds that try to still your food. Be on guard! The rooms are very nice with comfortable beds. There's a very generous size hot tub. This hotel is right in the beach and its a private beach which makes it worth the price to me. The waters are beautiful and clear especially during the spring time.
reviews.title: Beachfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hilton is a small oceanfront hotel. It is closing for renovation July 24th. You can tell that this is an older hotel but everything is neat and clean. We had breakfast outdoors just steps away from the beach. It was buffet style and the food was very good. It is in a good location not far from St Armands Circle.
reviews.title: Neat and clean but shows its age.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location and staff....very relaxed comfortable stay....recommend highly. The beach, pool, restaraunt, bar, maid staff were all very accomodating for our entire group. The hotel will be closed in July 2013 for renovations and not reopen until 2014 sometime....hope when it does the atmosphere is the same because I plan on returning....have familt in the area.
reviews.title: April family reunion trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had another wonderful stay here. As always the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is amazing. Sadly we won't be back before the refurb. I hope they don't change the character of the hotel too much. It's a bit colonial - love it!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here many times and have always enjoyed our visits. The location is second to none and the staff are always courteous and efficient. Whilst I agree that the hotel is in need of refurbishment, I hope the new look will not lose the essential character of the place. We have had a wonderful time and I would like to think we will visit again when the refurb is complete.
reviews.title: Yet another lovely visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a last minute decision and I cannot express enough how wonderful our stay was at this location! Ty, at the front desk, could not have been more accommodating. He booked our reservation for dinner, shared with them it was our anniversary and was sat with a beautiful water view. He had a delicious dessert requested for us (free!) and had champagne and fresh strawberries sent to our room. We were overjoyed with the special treatment we received at this Hilton. The rooms were very clean, the beachfront was spectacular. The beach chairs were already set up on the beach and beach towels were provided. For a nominal fee of $15 per day, we rented an umbrella, which was set up for us. It was lovely and we will definately go back to this gem of a resort! Highly reccommended...
reviews.title: Fabulous Anniversary weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is due for refurbishment (this year) but we had a fantastic holiday on the beachfront at Longboat Key. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds and good size bathrooms. It may be showing its age a little but we like it the way it is. The staff are excellent and helpfull throughout - but a special mention of Denis on reception - who makes you relax from the moment you arrive. The restuarant is beachfront so don't expect the Ritz but that is the charm of the hotel - you are at the beach! Expect exotic birds, and dolphins to pass by every day and if the mood takes you take a trip to Anna Marie Island five miles away to relax even more!
reviews.title: Excellent location and friendly staff make this a relaxing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note to Management - please don't lose the charm of this relaxing and friendly hotel by making it more formal and bigger. Looking forward to our fourth trip to Longboat Key next year!
reviews.title: Not Good Value For The Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this hotel is closing for renovations, then all I can say is that it's long overdue. If you're a fan of a good shower with water pressure then this is not your place.On the second floor and water barely trickles out of the shower head. There were a few mold spots in the bathroom and you can easily see the patchwork that has been done to give the illusion of a refreshed bathroom, The a/c in the room is very noisy. If you want an umbrella by the pool you may want to get there at 5AM and stake a claim. Way too few umbrellas for the guests wanting them. Big scramble when one opens up.The tiki bar is humble at best. Had the feeling that the workers there know that they may be out of a job when renovations start and they are just not that enthused about the job and sadly the guests. Wait for the new hotel.
reviews.title: A Work in Progress

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Friendly, helpful faces great you at every turn at this beachfront hotel. While the staff is provided by a private company, it was interesting to note that Hilton employees were everpresent, clipboards in hand to follow up on the overall work effort. Still, the hotel is sorely in need of renovation to bring it up to the Hilton standard, something Hilton will undertake this summer. The hotel is beautifully located on the beach about mid-key among other resort destinations and private residences. The footprint is small so unless other land is acquired, such as tennis courts or other amentities will not be available even after a renovation. In all however, one hopes that the new Hilton will offer more and better facilities like an upgraded restaurant/lounge, exercise room, and newer furnishings. The amount of investment is crucial to future success. I look forward to staying here again after the renovation.
reviews.title: Exceptional In Every Way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second year we've visited the Hilton Resort on Longboat Key and we had a wonderful time again this year. The front desk staff was very friendly and also very helpful when we decided to extend our stay for one more day. We had an awesome room facing the gulf with a spacious balcony. Breakfast each morning was very yummy and so nice to be able to eat outside with a view of the water. We are sad to hear that they'll be closing for a year long renovation because we won't be able to stay here next May but we're looking forward to visiting when they reopen.
reviews.title: Laid Back, Great Views and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Nice hotel in a nice location but happy they are closing it at the end of August to do much needed renovations. I believe once the renovations are complete (hopefully including much better wireless access that you don't have to sit in your bathroom to get), it will be a great hotel to visit for business and vacation.
reviews.title: Worn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in October and we loved it. We would stay here again on our next trip. The location is perfect. The beach was beautiful. We ordered room service upon arrival. The food was great. We did eat at the hotel restaurant the one night also. Although the prices were a little high, the food was awesome and totally worth the money.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach, the pool and the sun how can you go wrong??? A wonderful experience whether it be business or pleasure, you can always count on Hilton Hotels to be a leader in the industry. Plan your weekend get away and enjoy all the amenities. . . close to St Armand's circles and Lido Beach.
reviews.title: A Great Weekend get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is actually the second time my wife and I have stayed at this Resort......the previous time was last February and I didn't review it at the time but decided that this time I just had to say something. This is an extraordinary lodging, primarily because of the longevity of both the staff and the guests. The hotel was built in the early seventies and its age is showing, hence its planned closing on August 31st for renovation. The facility can certainly stand some renewing, it has a little osteoporosis. But the people who work here as employees or outside contractors are just simply remarkable. And the guests, many of whom we have met and talked with during each of our stays, are almost all repeat guests......many times for 30+ years....they just keep coming back to this same property.....from Europe, from all over the U.S....they all express an affection, even passion for this property and its staff which is just surreal. These visitors come for weeks at a time.....and they all express a feeling, which we have also felt after only two visits, of being at home with your own family. If anyone operating another hotel anywhere wants to personally observe what real service looks like, they should come and stay here before its too late. The facility needs renovating.....no doubt about it....to compete in today's world of hotel competition.......the facility can be renovated......but I and everyone I have spoken with at this Hilton Resort, guests and employees.....to a person....believe when this property closes for renovation, they'll be attending a funeral. The employees and guests don't love this place.....they are in love with this place. The facility can be replaced but the tradition and spirit of this place can never be replaced. It's the end of an era.....the hotel business has changed.....and "progress" causes eras to end. I'm sure what follows will be more attuned to its own era.....but it won't feel like this. Of that I feel certain. RIP Hilton Resort Longboat Key.
reviews.title: This resort is going to be missed by a LOT of people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is small and feels intimate. When we checked in, I kept thinking "this hotel has limited ammenities", but by the time we checked out, I realized that is what makes it great. After three days, I felt we knew everyone on staff, and they were all friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is closing in August for refurbishment. The only negatives I can come up with are: the countertop in our bathroom was cracked in two places, the boardwalk needs to be replaced and the business center needs to be expanded (it now consists of one computer in the lobby).
reviews.title: Excellent service and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We look forward to returning after they reopen next year.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just checked in after a frantic morning due to flight back to UK being cancelled. Couldn't stay at current place. Stayed here last September for two weeks and really enjoyed it so we decided to see if they had a room for tonight. Ty could not have been more helpful and we were able to have the room straight away which really helped. The room is lovely and quite large with a nice patio area so we are delighted.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Had a beachfront room, great views, and sounds, and sunsets. Pricy but worth every penny for the view! Place could use a bit of freshening up especially around outdoor bar and restaurant. Lots of stuff all over the place making it look unkempt. Bartender, Billy, very friendly and helpful with local recommendations.
reviews.title: This is a lovely small hotel in a perfect location.

aka: Hilton Longboat Key Beachfront Hotel Longboat Key
description: The Hilton Longboat Key is nestled among ancient Banyan trees on the picturesque island of Longboat Key, just off the coast of Bradenton and Sarasota. A 102-room boutique-size property, the Hilton Longboat Key is the kind of place that you come to for a relaxing vacation where you dig your toes in the powdery-white sand and sip on tropical drinks while you watch dolphins and manatees swim by. Just 8 miles South on Lido Key, the 100 shops and restaurants of St. Armands Circle will satisfy the shopaholic in you, as well as your cravings for fresh seafood, frozen drinks and upscale fare. The water rules here, and there is plenty to do to become one with our island lifestyle --- you can rent jet skis and sailboats right out on our beach, or take a kayak nature tour through the mangroves on Lido Key. Our team invites you to relax and enjoy all that the Longboat Key area has to offer.
